abstract: Wal-Mart, the nation’s largest private employer, said more than half of its U.S. workers had enrolled in the company’s health insurance plan.
snippet: Wal-Mart, the nation’s largest private employer, said more than half of its U.S. workers had enrolled in the company’s health insurance plan.
lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart, the nation’s largest private employer, said on Tuesday that for the first time in its 46-year history more than half its United States workers had enrolled in the company’s health insurance plan, a milestone for a retailer long criticized as offering unaffordable benefits.

headline.main: Wal-Mart Says More Than Half Its Workers Have Its Health Insurance
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart Crosses a Health Insurance Threshold
